meanings.definition: To defeat or conquer in a competition or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The team overthrows their opponents in the final match.
meanings.sent2: She overthrows the reigning champion to claim the title.
meanings.sent3: The underdog overthrows the favorite, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her determination overthrows any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The sudden storm overthrows their chances of winning the game.

meanings.definition: The act of overthrowing or causing the downfall of a ruler or government.
meanings.sent1: The overthrow of the dictator led to a new era of freedom.
meanings.sent2: The history books document many overthrows of monarchies.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie portrays a humorous overthrow of a fictional king.
meanings.sent4: The revolution was an unexpected overthrow of the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent5: The rebellion's success was a dramatic overthrow of power.
